//
// Phone numbers come in many different formats, both standardized as well as
// folk formats. It's important to capture all of them, as well as weird blends,
// so a good starting place is the following regex:
//
//   (\+?\1)?((\d\d\d|\(\d\d\d\))[\.\-\ ]\d\d\d[\.\-\ ]\d\d\d\d)
//
// It might also make sense to incorporate extensions as well, eg. with a suffix
// of the form `ext\.? \d+`, but for now we omit this because extensions by
// themselves aren't all that useful.
